title: Petrography and Geochemistry of the Leonardville Kimberlite, Riley County, Kansas
snippet: The Leonardville kimberlite intrudes Lower Permian sedimentary rocks, forms a slight topographic high, and has a magnetic direction approximately normal to the axis of the Abilene Anticline. The Leonardville kimberlite is a medium-grained intrusive kimerlite breccia. Most inclusions consist of country rocks, but two igneous inclusions were also noted. The minerals at Leonardville are: serpentinized olivine and pyroxene, severely altered biotite or phlogopite, garnet (50 percent pyrope, 30 percent almandine, 20 percent …

publication_info.summary: RG Dyer, DG Brookins - Transactions of the Kansas Academy of Science …, 1970 - JSTOR
